intro: Parnassia longshengensis, commonly known as the Longsheng lady's mantle, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, greenish-yellow fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
